Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; exterior slipp white and glazed (fired red and partly worn); inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The size of the sherd and the lack of diagnostic details makes it difficult to determine to what style the sherd belongs. The curvature suggests that it is later than the early patterned and Wild Goat Style chalices and perhaps no later than the Chalice Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0697) (phase 2)
